alert.note: Alert for Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 28 at 8:29PM CDT until May 28 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN NORTON COUNTY... At 828 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles northwest of Edmond, or 12 miles south of Norton, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE... At 810 PM CDT Trained weather spotters reported accumulating hail and up to quarter sized hail near Prairie Dog Lake. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lenora, Edmond and Densmore. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
